intro: Tordylium aegaeum, commonly known as the Greek bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its stems are upright and branching. Tordylium aegaeum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
